timeline.bodyText: why are we changing the port for run?  Can we have run --debug-jvm on port 8000 and :integTest  -Ddebug.es=1 on port 5005 ?
timeline.author: vamshin
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -34,15 +34,15 @@ OR
 ./gradlew run --debug-jvm # to just start a cluster that can be debugged
 ```
 
-The Elasticsearch server JVM will launch suspended and wait for a debugger to attach to `localhost:8000` before starting the Elasticsearch server.
+The Elasticsearch server JVM will connect to a debugger attached to `localhost:5005` before starting.

replies.bodyText: Why do we want to have them to run on 2 different ports? Is there a case where they would need to be run at the same time?
replies.author: jmazanec15

replies.bodyText:
Yes we may need to run both simultaneously in the case when you want to debug integ tests. Because integration tests run on different jvm and cluster on different jvm
./gradlew run --debug-jvm -Ddebug.es=1

replies.bodyText:
Not sure why you would do ./gradlew run --debug-jvm -Ddebug.es=1. Do you mean running something like:
./gradlew integTest -Ddebug.es=1 -Dtest.debug=1?
Also I will change debug.es to be consistent with naming conventions.
